author: Staff Reporter
text:
Tamil Nadu Forest Department’s Gudalur Forest Division officials on Tuesday removed encroachments in Thorappli village, bordering the Mudumalai Tiger Reserve.

According to sources, eight hutments had come up on the land that The Nilgiris district administration had notified as forest in 1986.

Hutments

The land in question was also declared Janmam land, the sources said and added that officials went there, removed the hutments and also confiscated the materials placed for constructing more hutments. The officials then alerted their Revenue Department counterparts for follow-up action.
title: Encroachments removed
